headline.main: United Nations Formally Kicks Off Race for Next Secretary-General
headline.print_headline: United Nations Formally Kicks Off Race for Next Secretary-General

docs.snippet: The United Nations formally kicked off the race for the next secretary-general on Tuesday and the world body's 193 members were encouraged to consider putting forward a woman for the top job that has been held by a man for the past 70 years....
docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations formally kicked off the race for the next secretary-general on Tuesday and the world body's 193 members were encouraged to consider putting forward a woman for the top job that has been held by a man for the past 70 years.

headline.main: Chipotle Aims as Close to Perfect Food Safety as Possible
headline.print_headline: Chipotle Aims as Close to Perfect Food Safety as Possible

docs.snippet: Perfect food safety is not possible, but Chipotle is trying to get as close to that ideal as they can with new procedures and testing inside and outside their restaurants, the company's founder and CEO said Tuesday during a visit to Seattle....
docs.lead_paragraph: Perfect food safety is not possible, but Chipotle is trying to get as close to that ideal as they can with new procedures and testing inside and outside their restaurants, the company's founder and CEO said Tuesday during a visit to Seattle.

headline.main: Rabbi Gets Decade in Prison for Divorce Coercion Ring
headline.print_headline: Rabbi Gets Decade in Prison for Divorce Coercion Ring

docs.snippet: An Orthodox Jewish rabbi was sentenced Tuesday to a decade in prison after admitting to a judge he got caught up in his tough-guy image while leading a ring that coerced religious divorces from recalcitrant men....
docs.lead_paragraph: An Orthodox Jewish rabbi was sentenced Tuesday to a decade in prison after admitting to a judge he got caught up in his tough-guy image while leading a ring that coerced religious divorces from recalcitrant men.

headline.main: DC Officials Release Body Camera Video Related to Death
headline.print_headline: DC Officials Release Body Camera Video Related to Death

docs.snippet: District of Columbia officials publicly released footage from a police body camera Tuesday and asked for the public's help in learning more about the death of a special education teacher taken into custody by security guards at a Washington apartm...
docs.lead_paragraph: District of Columbia officials publicly released footage from a police body camera Tuesday and asked for the public's help in learning more about the death of a special education teacher taken into custody by security guards at a Washington apartment building.

headline.main: Teen Convicted in Rape, Murder of High School Math Teacher
headline.print_headline: Teen Convicted in Rape, Murder of High School Math Teacher

docs.snippet: A Massachusetts teenager was convicted Tuesday of raping and killing his high school math teacher when he was 14....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Massachusetts teenager was convicted Tuesday of raping and killing his high school math teacher when he was 14.

headline.main: UN Cracks Open Secrecy on Selecting Next Secretary-General
headline.print_headline: UN Cracks Open Secrecy on Selecting Next Secretary-General

docs.snippet: The United Nations Security Council and General Assembly have taken the first step toward removing the secrecy around selecting the next U.N. secretary-general, sending a joint letter inviting member states to submit candidates for the post....
docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations Security Council and General Assembly have taken the first step toward removing the secrecy around selecting the next U.N. secretary-general, sending a joint letter inviting member states to submit candidates for the post.

headline.main: Suspended Dominican Diplomat Cites Immunity in UN Case
headline.print_headline: Suspended Dominican Diplomat Cites Immunity in UN Case

docs.snippet: A Dominican Republic diplomat asked a judge Tuesday to toss out charges against him in the United Nations bribery scandal, saying he's entitled to immunity....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Dominican Republic diplomat asked a judge Tuesday to toss out charges against him in the United Nations bribery scandal, saying he's entitled to immunity.

headline.main: How the Dow Jones Industrial Average Fared on Tuesday
headline.print_headline: How the Dow Jones Industrial Average Fared on Tuesday

docs.snippet: Stocks posted their biggest gains in more than a week Tuesday, led by rising energy companies and banks. The Standard & Poor's 500 index climbed for the second day in a row, something that hadn't happened since the beginning of November....
docs.lead_paragraph: Stocks posted their biggest gains in more than a week Tuesday, led by rising energy companies and banks. The Standard & Poor's 500 index climbed for the second day in a row, something that hadn't happened since the beginning of November.
